Reviews.Title: “Despite some bad reviews, we were happy here”
Reviews.Author: Dot13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on March 9 for one night, purchasing the package deal for the Van Gogh exhibit. Before booking, I checked Trip Advisor and was dismayed to see some negative reviews. However, one person basically said, hey, it's a good value in a good neighborhood, free parking, stop complaining. I decided to go with that person's review and we were not sorry. Yes, the hotel is a little older. However, the staff was great, rooms were clean, and we had no problems. The fact that we purchased the package deal got us a continental breakfast (cereal, muffins, bagels, toast, yogurt, coffee, juice) and two tickets to the Van Gogh exhibit. They allowed us to check in early on Friday and we went to the flower show, leaving our car there. The next day we checked out, and then they allowed us to leave our car there while we went to the museum, which was in close walking distance. I would definitely stay here again when in Philadelphia. We are not luxury hotel people and really just use our accommodations for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Andy L
Reviews.Content: As far as the room and the common areas are concerned, you get what you pay for. No real complaints, it was what I expected for the price. they had recently repainted the door frames in the corridors so its nice to see they are making incremental improvements. The location is great, walking distance to the Rodin Museum and other attractions. I will say that the best part was the staff. They were very courteous and friendly which made the experience pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMargaret
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for price and location. It is walking distance to the Art and Rodin museums, an organic market and Wawa. The parking is free. Breakfast is not included but there are a restaurant and bar on site. The hotel is basic/standard, nothing special. If you are willing to risk it, pick up a coupon book at a fast food restaurant and get a better hotel for the same price on a walk-in basis.

Reviews.Title: “Optional for low budget”
Reviews.Author: chm476
Reviews.Content: Located close to city and all city attraction, needs some more cleanliness and comfortable bed. Less money to stay and poor service for same. little dark hallways, I will never stay hotel again. there is nothing more to say about place.

Reviews.Title: “One star is too generous for this dump......”
Reviews.Author: antonyschn
Reviews.Content: I was adamant that I was going to write to Best Western upon return to the UK about this terrible hotel. I have never felt like this after a hotel stay before (and there have been many) In short, I can't be bothered so i'll just share my pics here!! It wasn't very cheap, it's dated, dirty, the staff are morose,it smells horrible,The air con sounded like a not so distant tsunami,Internet constantly dropped out,The tv didn't work properly, The window didn't even latch shut in my room & I worried for my possesions throughout my whole visit. Hell, they couldn't even through in a breakfast to counter the bad points somewhat! How a multi-national like Best Western continue to have this hell hole in their portfolio beggars belief!!!

Reviews.Title: “Scary, dirty, unfriendly... Worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: twps
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here after my reservations in a downtown hotel were mixed up and I was without a room on a business trip during a large conference. This was my only choice for places with availability at the last minute, and I can see why. Check-in was mixed up as the person taking the phone reservation didn't share the information with the other team members. This resulted in delays, confusion and me being turned away at one point. It was resolved when the person who took the phone reservation showed up. Room - The door locks were broken, including the chain lock which is the secondary security system. The room smelled bad and was generally worn down and dirty. Power in my room wasn't always available for unknown reasons. The only working plug was in the washroom, and the lights didn't always work in there either. Unfortunately, no other rooms were available in the hotel or the city. General impression - There were workers doing work in other rooms in overalls. Removing a blood stained mattress from the room across the hall. This was occurring as I was going to my room for the first time. Not a great impression, nor were the people who appeared to be homeless hanging out in the main floor washroom and lobby. On my last morning, after two nights (thankfully) a lady from a neighboring building was waiting for a cab, which we shared downtown. She asked if we actually stayed there and said she thought it had been closed for a while and was supposed to be torn down to make way for condominiums. This may be the same reason they were not taking reservations and turning walk-ins away on the morning our group checked out. (Vacating several rooms) I had a cab driver tell me the same thing that this place was closed down and was shocked I Was staying there. I wouldn't recommend this facility, the location isn't great and the general atmosphere is sketchy. If it wasn't for the conference I would have left the city all together.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Best Western Standards”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Tennessean
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed with some aspects of the hotel. It was close to major attractions with free parking and for the price, a better deal then other downtown hotels. However, the hotel really shows signs of its age. The hallways look like a renovated basement and the rooms look old judging from the appearance of the walls, doors, vents and fixtures. Our bathroom door did not close properly and, much like a prior reviewer, the faucet would not turn off unless you found the right spot (either we had the same room or many rooms are like that). The bathroom was not well cleaned either, especially the toilet which looked as though it had been neglected for some time. While other Best Westerns offer a free breakfast, this one did not. A buffet was available, but did not look that great and, at 12.95 per person, did not entice me to try it. Instead, we got some breakfast at a Wawa food market across the street. We only stayed overnight, so it was bearable for a short time, but I would look elsewhere if coming back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated.....but so am I...I liked it very much!”
Reviews.Author: DCJim1
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews here about this place and was skeptical. I have to tell you, the place was great. I think some reviewers listed here want the world but donâ€™t want to pay for it. This is a value hotel; location costs, parking cost in a major cityâ€¦..if you want to pay $300 and for parkingâ€¦.go to Penn Sq. If you want to pay less than half thatâ€¦stay here. Itâ€™s an older place and is a little datedâ€¦but so am I and if it ainâ€™t broke, you donâ€™t need to fix it. I am more traditionalâ€¦I donâ€™t like the retro look of the newer places like the Hard Rock. Property is in a great location with loads of FREE parking. Good sports bar on the property that locals hang out at; if locals hang out, you know the place is good. Lots of great bars in a nice neighborhood that is safeâ€¦.just a short walk to the Rocky Movie Steps. Eastern Penn is just up the street if you want to check it out. The room was very clean with a fantastic bed and it had everything â€¦.coffee in roomâ€¦..adjustable heatâ€¦.desk with a new ergo chairâ€¦hair dryerâ€¦iron and board (both new and clean.) Free and fast wireless internet. Nice fast check inâ€¦.nice lobbyâ€¦â€¦people at the place are very nice. They also provided a veteran and military discount. â€¦â€¦I want to stay here again and will.

Reviews.Title: “worst western”
Reviews.Author: Peggyels
Reviews.Content: Best Western should take it's name off this property. The rugs were filthy, lighting dim, everything completely run down. The only thing it has going for it is location, but it is still not worth staying here. We went to Philly to see Terror Behind the Walls, and felt like we were staying at the Bates Motel. The staff was fine to us, although if I had to work in this dump I would be very grouchy too.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: DJS430
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive but very unfriendly front desk! Clean rooms but very run down, a bit scary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inexpensive place to stay in Philadelphia.”
Reviews.Author: Chattsteam57
Reviews.Content: We used a coupon from Roomsaver to book this hotel at a great rate and I wouldn't hesitate to do it again. The location is great, parking is free, amazing view of the city, and it was clean. The service was good and pleasant. It's not a brand new hotel with a bunch of bells and whistles, but to me it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: preetamk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a descent place to stay for a night. There is ample free parking. At 150 USD including taxes, it was the cheapest hotel around. The place is in a peaceful neighbourhood. There is gym. No complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Joyala1227
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible~unfriendly staff, old, dull drab interior. Not particularly clean and very depressing. Walked by closet for fire extinguisher...which was missing. I would rather never vacation in my life again than stay there. The owner should be ashamed of themselves. There are so many other options in Philadelphia for similar pricing. Ended up gonig to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dobbys_sock
Reviews.Content: Central location was wonderful - we were within walking distance of everything we wanted. The staff, too, were very accommodating. Best part, however, was the abundance of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Franchise owner should be ashamed...”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Oh my god!!! If I had known the condition of this hotel I never would have booked reservations. Next time I am going to read the reviews in Travelocity. I guess if I had to work in such a dump I too would have a poor attitude. The staff was not rude but not very friendly either. Let me make a list: Hallways smelled. Sports bar is a hang out for locals to drink and play pool. Hallway lighting is dim and depressing with dark outdated colors. Room door was difficult to close and lock. Furniture was worn. bathtub drain was clogged. toilet seat was broken, Window casing was broken and would not close completely. bedspread stained. TV outdated w/ only 15 dish stations that repeatedly lost signal. Do yourself a favor, stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “great location needs an uplift”
Reviews.Author: toc82
Reviews.Content: perfect location to walk in the fairmount park/museum area, easy to get to great free parking, but inside needed upgrades in all areas it was dark and dingy. The elevator rattled. The doors were old the bathroom was very small and not super clean. Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “May be i will not go to philadelphia again because of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: grdodo
Reviews.Content: No more than scarey ,disgasting,bad service and unfriendly staff. spider webs on the window I got depression from this hotel before my USMLE exam....very narrow dark rooms It is not a hotel ...It's a prison the worest internet service i have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice for the price & if your on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: LadyTwiZta_5
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived the hotel staff was kind of rude, because I did not have a voucher showing that I paid for the hotel through one of the booking websites, I just had the emailing showing that I did pay for it. But I had to remember that "up north" folk speak kind of forcefully, and it seems like they are being rude, but are not. Overall the hotel was average, nothing too fancy, but reasonable for the price. The beds were VERY comfortable. No mircowaves, or refridgerators in the room. The elevator was a little shabby and needs to be updated. The prices at the restaurant were a little high, and the bar was okay. The pool was very nice and my little cousins really enjoyed it. The hotel is in a great spot, convienent to everything. The housekeeper for our floor, gave EXCEPTIONAL service and was extremely friendly, I made sure that I told her goodbye before we left. I would definitely stay at this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you are looking for location and price”
Reviews.Author: FlyHigh314
Reviews.Content: If you don't want an affordable hotel that is in Philadelphia, then this is it. We were visiting family that live near the Eastern State Penitentiary. So location was important. The price matched the hotel quality. The bar downstairs may seem a bit sketchy in the evening but the food and drink were good. The hotel is old and the rooms look it, but everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mountain2109
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and tidy, although the corridors are shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Comfortable & Clean”
Reviews.Author: manhospassoc
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th or 5th time my wife and I have stayed here in the last three years. We enjoy going to the Museums on the BF Parkway. We just stayed overnight but check in was fast and we were able to get into our room by noon ( even though the hotel seemed very busy). The desk person was very friendly and we received what we reserved- a king bedded non smoking room. The room was nice and the bathroom was very clean. We went to an exhibit at the franklin museum and came back to the Hotel after dinner. It was great to leave our car in the Hotel parking Lot ( a huge value as parking is free at the Hotel). We walked to the museum in ten minutes. We had a very comfortable bed and a firm mattress which we like..We left early in the Morning..a real nice visit and we will come back in the summer to go to the Art Museum...

Reviews.Title: “Scary and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: TooTravelers
Reviews.Content: Blood on the towel bar, a deadbolt that wouldn't function, inarticulate desk worker, threadbare sheets...if we had arrived early enough to find another place we would have. I don't know why Best Western doesn't revoke the franchise.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy”
Reviews.Author: OHIOJOE14
Reviews.Content: Elevators were slow,but they were vintage, breakfast was suprisingly good,but the rooms absolute BS Hard as Concrete beds Primitive cable no twc btw, and decor that hasn't left the 1950s YUK!!

Reviews.Title: “A dump, plain and simple.”
Reviews.Author: FrankWMcBride
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference taking place nearby. If the cockroach in the toilet was not immediately indicative of the quality, perhaps the sections of ceiling covered with loosely attached plywood were. My bathroom was not clean and the shower pooled above my ankles while I was using it. No provided breakfast, but a poor quality one can be purchased at the adjoining restaurant. One thing to be said for this is its location; not only is it within walking distance of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, but also several decent hotels of comparable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly at a good price”
Reviews.Author: dragonladyrvrr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here every time (except when sold out on marathon sat nite) when I have come to philly. Considering the area the price is excellant. It doesn't look like much from the outside but the rooms are clean and fresh, the staff is helpful and friendly and the parking is right there and free. Last year I had to stay at the Hyatt on Columbus on the water and I hated it-High price, charge for parking and snooty staff. This little gem in the city is a joy to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but many convenient features for us.”
Reviews.Author: mollymorm
Reviews.Content: The room was exactly as you would expect with no frills. The check-in staff were adequate. Free parking in well lit lot. Our beds had great mattresses and coverlets and were very comfortable. For an older hotel, I thought it was very quiet and heard little noise from other guests. There was quite a lot of city traffic noise when cars were honking, trucks backing up, sirons from emergency vehicles heard from the street through our large window which looked out on a beautiful city landscape. At night the lights were quite spectacular. Alathought we had a car, it was most convenient to use the bus to Independance Visitor Center and all the inner-city sites ($ 2.00 each way, 20 minutes and the pick up and drop off were immedicately outside the hotel.) There is a 24 hour market across the street with food, drinks,snacks, 24 hour Dominos, a police station, and a few fast food restaurants. We walked 4 blocks north to Fairmont Street and found many fun local restaurants for dinner. We particularly liked the Urban Saloon (sat outdoors and watched the visitors attending the haunted house at Estern States Prison who were greeted by many ghoulish characters.) I felt safe to walk everywhere in the area. The phone in our room never did work and I felt the elevator was always a risk to ride, but I would stay here again. It worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not classy, but suitable for a short citytrip”
Reviews.Author: EazyK
Reviews.Content: Don't take this hotel if you expect a romantic hideaway or a luxury stay. This hotel probably should have been razed to the ground and completely rebuilt, but for some reason that never happened. Now you can enjoy a good value for your money in this hotel. Philadelphia is certainly not a cheap city to stay, and this hotel has a good location. It is in the museum district (so not really downtown Philly), so your cultural needs can be satisfied steps away from the door of the hotel. To go to the center of the city a taxi is recommended. By night that will costs you less than $10. Parking is free, so you can take your own car as well. The rooms of the hotel are not so classy, but the bed is actually quite good. There is cable TV and free WiFi available. The bathroom is basic, but clean. By night the view from the rooms on the south side of the hotel is a great Philadelphia Skyline. If you want to discover the city, and would only like to sleep in a clean hotel with a good bed for a decent price this is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “A Shabby Cave”
Reviews.Author: 22Peripatetic
Reviews.Content: Imagine a grim, dark cave of many rooms and long, bleak hallways. Now add old carpets in dismal patterns. Remove almost all electric lights, and install low-wattage bulbs in the few remaining fixtures. Welcome to the Best Western Center City Philadelphia! I'd be hard pressed to think of an uglier, shabbier, more depressing hotel. It would cost too much even if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “If convenience and price are your thing :)”
Reviews.Author: MedicmanOttawa
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Philly late and wanted a central location to stay....this was in a brochure we grabbed at a rest stop and location/price seemed ideal (we have used Best Western before and usually with good results)....we checked in quite quickly and eficiently with the front desk and proceeded to the on site bar/restaurant for some pool and drinks..again very nice....once retiring to the room for the evening we noted that the room A/C is very inefficient (considering the heat, not good)..anyway, we called to the front desk for 10 min with no answer, so we walked down and sure enough; the clerk was playing music on his computer and that was kind of annoying, but he did quickly put us i another room that was beyond hot, we had the clerk come to the room and see if the AC in this room worked as we were unable to get it going :) Finally, we got our 3rd room (mainly because no staff at night could fix or even troubleshoot the A/C.... The 3rd room was nice and a bit cooler (the A/C worked )..the shower rod however was completely loose and I nearly lost my balance grabbing a towel....it was a unique stay for sure...but really it is also part of the adventure of travelling...the service may be slow in some respects but it got the job done :) I recommend this place if you have an open mind and sense of adventure... The outdoor pool is awesome though :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special but good enough”
Reviews.Author: Poacher33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at this hotel in June. Overall the hotel has definitely seen better days, but overall it did the job. The hotel is in a really good location for touring around the city, and we always felt safe. They do have a pool - the water is really cold. Overall we would recommend this hotel for a night or two if you just need a place to sleep for the night. If you are looking for luxury this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wrecking ball required”
Reviews.Author: goofytraveller
Reviews.Content: The location is the only thing going for this hotel- it is smack dab in the middle of the museum district. Toilet rocked, water to toilet ran almost non stop; bathroom door didn't shut -out of alignment by over 1 inch, once you managed to get it shut it woke everyone up trying to get out; tub very slow to drain - well over ankle deep by end of fast shower. (all of this would have been noticed by the cleaning staff, so should not have had to be reported by me). Entire hotel very humid - ended up with terrible sinus headache/infection. Had large fans in hallways (like ones used to clear out smoke after major fires) to dry out musty corridors. Rooms had thermostas for airconditioning, but the thermostats were not working correctly - therefore the air was either on full blast or off, nothing in between. I feel badly for the cleaning staff as I suspect they don't get the tips they deserve given the poor state of repair this facility is in. If gutted and rebuilt it would give the big "reputable" hotels a run for thier money. Definitely not a 3 star hotel. I woudn't give it anything higher than a 1.5

Reviews.Title: “Good Location + Price”
Reviews.Author: lukino6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a nice location, not far from the city centre and the main train/bus station. The reception staff was nice and they upgraded me from a single to a twin room, free of charge. They also advised me of the nearest supermarket. The room itself was very spacious. The only negatives were that the bathroom was not very clean, there were loose objects, such as the shower head and handle on the door. The aircondition was working properly but made a very loud noise even when it was off, it sounded as it were leaking heavily. There was a vending machine with drinks and snacks and an ice-machine in the corridors. To my disappointment the outdoor swimming pool was not filled with water yet, even though the temparatures during the day was+ 35 degrees. Other than that, I have no complaints and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: manhospassoc
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed in the last two years. We bought the Picasso Package they offered at a great rate for the exhibit at the Phila Art Museum. We had a great stay. Nice Friendly front desk staff that recognized us and welcomed us back. We were there last year for the Cezanne Package. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. We had dinner in the Sports bar and the service and food was fantastic. I like the location of this hotel and the free parking is great. I called the Courtyard and they charge $ 35 pluis tax for parking for overnight which paid for our dinner and breakfast at the Best Western. I will return later this year when there is another exhibit. I like this hotel and it has become my favorite in Philadephia for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Ritz, but I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: zdanielle
Reviews.Content: I know it's shabby and run down, but I have spent many happy times at the Best Western Center City. I think there's been a plan in place to tear this hotel down since at least 2006, the first time I stayed here, which may explain why they don't go ahead and renovate. I like the troika shape of the place and he curved halls, someone said it was modeled after the Fontainebleu in Miami, and the halls are curved to prevent disorientation from staring down really long hallways. I suspect this is an urban legend and it's just a low rent version of common 60s design, but I was touched by the pride the staff and regular customers have in this hotel. The sports bar off the lobby, the BW, is a fun friendly spot frequented by people in the neighborhood so it's a lot more fun than the usual hotel bar. There used to be two buildings, one was used as a Temple dorm, but they finally tore it down. Despite it's worn out vibe, I have found the staff here to be nothing but pleasant and helpful, much nicer and more professional than I've experienced at some more upscale hotels. This is a fun, reasonably priced hotel, and I always stay here when I'm in Philadelphia. The location is great, it's close to the river, museum of art, and Eastern State Penitentiary. The Rodin museum is right across the street. Downtown is about a 20-30 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Shamare252
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting UPenn. I thought because of its location, it would be a nice place, but it was one of the worst hotel stays have ever experienced. The staff was creepy, the rooms were uncomfortable, and they had bedbugs. There was a restaurant in this place, but not open, and the staff was not at all helpful in helping us find a place to get food. Almost made me never want to return to Philadelphia ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday 2009”
Reviews.Author: GemmaCaine
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel! We enjoyed our stay loads! Right next to the Rocky Steps and public transport easily accessible!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Smedel
Reviews.Content: It's an OK place if you're just passing through and need a place to sleep. The room itself was clean, bed comfortable, bathroom spotless. Interior hallways are dark and could use redecorating. Front desk staff very pleasant/helpful. The card key entry door locks to the rooms are confusing as there are no instructions on the door and what's printed on the card keys themselves doesn't unlock the door. Observed other guests struggling with them too so it's not just my stupidity!

Reviews.Title: “clean, great location, super value”
Reviews.Author: Neanyray
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row that we stayed @ this hotel over Thanksgiving. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is clean and centrally located. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good price & location”
Reviews.Author: Aussiesandy77
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spend 3 nights at the Best Western City Center over Thanksgiving. The hotel has plenty of free parking which meant we could leave our car and walk or get the bus to where we were going around the city. The hotel is close to the #48 bus stop which took us to down town (Independence Hall) in about 15mins. Our room was clean, comfortable & quiet. The hotel really needs to do some updating of the elevators and the hallways - they are all out dated. We had no problem getting connected with the free wi-fi in our room, it worked great. The price is reasonable compared to the other city center hotels. Would like to have had the breakfast included - I didn't think the $8.95 for the continental breakfast was worth the money for what was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Price range + Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LVinWA
Reviews.Content: Phillie's just as expensive as any other major city & this location in their Central City neighborhood along with reasonable rates make this BW good enough. Front desk staff courteous & attentive. Plenty of free parking in the back private lot. Sorely needs an updating (halls are in various shades of lavender) but rooms are clean & quiet. Don't know if I could handle more than 1 or 2 nights here, but it is a stone's throw from the museums and a quick drive or cab to South Phillie, Italian market and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay at another Best Western”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust711
Reviews.Content: I've traveled throughout the US and the world to industrialized and non-industrialized countries. This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at any where in the world, particularly for the price. They clearly don't use the money to invest in hotel maintenance--never mind upgrades! Everything was a joke: the "fitness center" was a 7x9' room that had outdated equipment and anything that was supposed to be electronic did not work so there was no way to add resistance or select any exercise programs. I was afraid to use the elevators as I truly do think they are original to the building and they shook and shuddered every time we got on--if we could get the door to close. The room bathroom was filthy with previous guests' hairs in the tub and dirt on the floor. The toilet paper holder and towel rack were pulled from the wall and hanging on by a ridiculous and dirty patch job done years before. The window in my room would not close though it was 40 degrees outside. There was no hot water (they did respond to that request quickly and the maintenance person was friendly). I found the front desk staff to be friendly 50% of the time and my hotel door key worked 33% of the time. The front desk manager herself was completely unhelpful. The wi-fi barely had a signal in my room and was extremely slow no matter where I tried to use it. Generally, it felt like the building was just falling down around us and that management is just a group of slumlords pocketing the money and not putting a dime into the place; the dank hallway decor and carpet felt original to the place too. There is no security in the building and there were a lot of strange characters coming and going. It was hard to tell if they were actually hotel guests. I wouldn't have felt safe staying her alone. I actually got on the Trip Advisor site to see if anyone complained about bed bugs because the entire place made my skin crawl and I'm afraid I brought bugs back in my luggage. My friend killed a huge cockroach in her room. I never expected this for a hotel that was charging $170/night. Unfortunately, the entire city was booked (in the middle of the week with nothing special going on) so we had no choice but to stay (which is what this hotel must rely upon). I've never stayed in a Best Western before but I thought their reputation was decent. After this experience, I'll never stay at a Best Western again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty drab but hey it's cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: gadgt69
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights and it was about what we expected from looking at pics on this website. The place is just a bit run down and there is a musty smell in the place. However the rooms are ok and there is free wi-fi which is great. The location is very good (rocky steps just 10 minutes walk away) The rooms were cleaned everyday and the staff were ok if not the happiest people on earth. To be honest we didn't spend that much time in the hotel anyway. The bed was clean and quite comfortable. The shower was also excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: MainetravelerBath
Reviews.Content: If you want a great hotel experience, this is not your place. However, if you can get past the dark hallways and oddly painted elevators and the semi-rude staff, the room itself is pretty comfortable. The later check-out time of noon is also convenient. With a discount, it is worth what you pay, but no more. I would go back to this hotel because of its location, but not for the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Dog Owners! Kicked out at midnight because dog barked. No refund offered.”
Reviews.Author: mwpenguin
Reviews.Content: This hotel uses the dog friendly label as a trap to steal from unsuspecting dog owners. It might as well be criminal. Here is what happened to me: my dog barked apparently shortly after I had checked in and had gone across the street to the convenience store for 5 minutes tops to get a few things. A neighbor complained to the front desk (this was at about 6 pm), and I got a voicemail on my cell phone saying I needed to return to quiet my dog. I was back within a few minutes and called the front desk back to say that I was back and would keep him quiet. The receptionist had a sneering tone in response, saying that he 'had' to be kept quiet, and was generally condescending to me during our conversation. Later that night, at about 11, he barked literally one more time, and we got a knock on the door from a security guard saying we had to leave the hotel. Between those two times, he had kept totally quiet. When we objected, the security guard at our door walked away down the hall before we could open the door and said 'he was going to call the police' to remove us. Keep in mind, this was because our dog had barked once, at a hotel that claims to accept pets. The receptionist told me we could stay, but would 'have to find a 24 hour kennel for our dog' - at 11pm - but he was no longer welcome at the hotel. He refused to even give a single chance for us to stay the night if the dog kept quiet, and he made sure to treat me like an offender instead of a customer while I tried to argue my point. He also refused to refund any part of our room fee, including the dog surcharge! They processed the credit card transaction as soon as we left... I called my credit card company. This hotel is foremost a total dump, and beyond that I have never been treated anywhere close to this poorly at any hotel in all of my 30 + years of travel. I just wanted to warn any prospecting dog owners against staying here, unless you are absolutely sure you can keep your dog silent. You might end up getting thrown out on the curb, and pay for the privilege. Beware, and don't doubt any of the negative reviews about the staff, theft, mistreatment etc...... I don't doubt that any of that happened exactly as described. An outrage! I will be much more wary of marginal hotels like this in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe what you read...”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld33
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of this Hotel and I absolutely had a great time. My children really enjoyed the pool and the staff was fantastic. We stayed for 4 nights and not one night did we experience what the readers are saying. The food in the sports bar was very good espec the Cheesesteaks. The FREE parking is definitely a plus espec. when you are on a "travel budget". We walked to all the major museums and there are plenty of eateries near by. The WAWA next door to the Hotel was open 24hrs as my husband ate a Hoagie everyday...we cant say enough about the Hotel. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. do yourself a favor...dont believe what others say, you have to see for yourself sometimes. We just want to Thank the staff for hosting us and we will certainly be back next year ttyl - Good Job mates!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and service "ok", but great value and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: skee77
Reviews.Content: This hotel could definitely use a renovation. I've stayed here twice, once in 2004 and again in 2007. The service was ok. The rooms were just ok too, but they were clean and we didn't see any bugs. The location was excellent, walking distance to the gallery and South St. If you're on a budget and plan on spending a lot of time out and about, go for it. If money is no object or you plan on spending a lot of time in your room, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed By Hotel Employees”
Reviews.Author: CCCNorthernNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with our dog. We left our dog alone in the room for 3 hours and our room was broken into by hotel employees. All our belongings were gone through and our stuff was turned upside down. We filed a police report and the hotel manager's response was our dog opened and moved everything in the room. This just illustrates the stupidity and unprofessionalism of this holel. Hotel staff must be desperate to steal cash and credit cards. Our room was broken into after 5pm so the hotel manager couldn't blame this one on the cleaning people. Don't ever stay as it is not safe at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consider renaming it a LEAST Western”
Reviews.Author: Teach1947
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, this hotel had problems. It took three tries using three different sets of key cards to get into our room. The maintenance man who met us at the room upon try #2 said the front desk clerk didn't know what she was doing in preparing the cards. (She was using a 20-year-old MacClassic computer to do so.) Corridors were dark and gloomy, not helped by navy blue carpeting and minimal lighting. Everything -- doors, furniture, etc. -- was worn or tired-looking. Two ceiling panels in the restaurant had come loose, allowing insulation to stick out. Why could no one fix that? We saw a maximum of six people using the restaurant for breakfast. Our room's sink had gunk around the overflow drain, and what appeared to be mold along the seam between bathtub and wall. I was nearly scalded when I turned on the shower; 45 minutes later my friend had an ice-cold shower in the same place. The water temperature was all over the place. The hair dryer did not work. The air conditioning system's thermostat had a stuck adjustment wheel, meaning we had a choice of 60 degrees or no a.c. When the a.c. was on, it was very noisy. The window had a screen with a hole in it, so opening a window wasn't an option. When the a.c. was not operating, the room was filled with the drone of some sort of electrical motor nearby. Earplugs helped. Weather stripping at the bottom of the room's door had pulled loose at one end. The two elevators appear to be original to this 1960s-era building. Our beds were comfortable, but the fitted sheet may have been a bit too small as one morning I awoke to find my face against the bare mattress. Returning to the hotel after a day's exploration, we noticed that fewer than 20% of the rooms had lights on that night -- we saw fewer than a dozen other patrons during our stay there. The neighborhood was OK; there's a police station across the street. The "continental breakfast" offered at $8.95 + tax consisted of cold cereal, slightly old bagels or danishes, yogurt, apples, etc. Juice and milk were served in tiny glasses, 4 oz or less. On the second day, fruit cocktail was added. The advertised $11.95 (+ tax) "full breakfast" was not available on either of the mornings, although the chafing dishes were there. One could also order from a menu, but costs would quickly surpass the $11.95 level and from what I could see from another patron's egg dish, it was nothing to write home about. Others have mentioned this hotel's main plus is its location. It's true that the Rodin Museum is quite close, but most others like the Franklin Institute are some distance away, so if you have young children or elderly in your party, don't plan to walk. Also, except for a take-away chicken place and a takeaway Chinese place, there is nothing by way of restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel's wi-fi was among the best I've experienced, with strong signals immediately available to my computer. There are no room safes, so if you wish to leave your computer, bring a security cable with you. The hotel's exterior featured a dead bush in the parking lot, and a disused swimming pool. Though it was warm outside, there was no sign any use of it was being considered. Free parking was the only other plus I can think of for this hotel. Upon checkout, I noticed behind the front desk a plaque from Best Western's District VII Director commending the hotel for its quality. It was dated January 2006. Either their inspector was very easy to please, or this hotel has taken a huge slide since then. I noticed that the hotel was "independently owned and operated." Nevertheless, Best Western should really consider whether it wants its name associated with this hotel, which needs significant renovation and infusion of capital in almost every aspect. Unfortunately, given Philly's notoriously high hotel prices (to which 15% must be added for taxes), there's little impetus for this hotel to shape up its act. Our two-night stay, with four continental breakfasts, came to about $322, not exactly cheap. Somehow, the bird poop I found on my car's trunk as we left seemed an appropriate symbol of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Well, well past it's prime”
Reviews.Author: Nelson43
Reviews.Content: This place passed it's prime in a previous lifetime. Updating should have occured years ago. Room was only passable and not worth the $129/night I paid for it. Frequently, there was no one at the front desk to assist guest with questions, check outs, etc. Next time, I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: BFM12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western over the Memorial Day weekend for a wedding we were attending in Philly. I was really worried, given the reviews, but our stay turned out to be fine. Sure, the hotel is old and certainly not luxurious, but it is centrally located and perfect if you are going to Philly to do something other than hang out in your hotel. We only used the hotel to sleep and change. The free parking is also a huge plus and unusual in Philly. Our room was clean and good enough. The staff was not attentive, but we really didn't need anything. I can't say enough about the location which allowed us to leave our car at the hotel, walk to the museum or take a cab ride into the center of Philly to the bars and restaurants for only $8. Depending on what you need it for, this hotel is fine and the price was fairly reasonable for a city on a holiday weekend. One caveat - our friend had booked out rooms for the wedding, so perhaps our rooms were cleaner and nicer than other reviewers rooms because they knew we were there for the wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Down to Basics”
Reviews.Author: travels1280
Reviews.Content: I frequent the philadelphia area often after growing up there. I've stayed here, the sheraton, the double tree, and many others. The Center City Best Western, when you factor in location and free parking continues to be the best value in the city. Sure, it's not luxury. it may be dingy at times. But if you really only plan on sleeping there and having a place to park, I recommend it every time.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID the "Worst Western"”
Reviews.Author: rightgirlwrongplanet
Reviews.Content: Wish I had read the reviews before staying here. My husband was sitting his USMLE in Market St so this was the closest hotel that didn't charge more then $150. The dbl room was $118. At that, it was poor value, considering it didn't include breakfast. I think the worst part was when I was alone in my room ready to leave in the morning and another guest walked in! Luckily I was fully clothed and the stranger did not pose any harm to my safety. The staff has made a mistake and checked him into a room that I was already checked into! Later, when I went out to get some ice, I was locked out of my room. Maintenance were helpful and checked the battery- that wasn't the problem. They arranged another key and informed me reception had inactivated both my cards when they checked in the other guest! The hotel is gloomy, dark, smelly and from the 1980s. It is crying out for refurbishment. We avoided breakfast charges ($13) by going to the 24hr store across the road which was a great store! I was uneasy at the sight of dogs getting checked in! Surprising seeing that other Best Western experiences have been pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “bring your rubber gloves!!”
Reviews.Author: gingerspecs
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel before reading the reviews, so I was expecting the worst. And the room was filthy. The dark blue carpet was white with fluff, 3 hotel pens lying on the floor where they had fallen, cigarette butts under the bed, filthy mirrors and enough dust to stuff a mattress. The carpet was still not hoovered 5 days later. I spent 2 hours cleaning up. Once the room was cleaner, the hotel was ok. The washbasin plug broke, and was promptly fixed. Then the ironing board would not fold up, but this was replaced pronto. The lighting consisted of 3 lamps, one of which conked out. I replaced the bulb, but that was not the problem. By this stage, I did not bother reporting it!!! Problems apart, the hotel was very central, great food, friendly staff. But the housekeepers must check that the rooms have been cleaned properly.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room; checked out after 2 hours.”
Reviews.Author: catpower2000
Reviews.Content: The bed sheets were dirty, everything smelled bad, and all the surfaces were greasy. Stayed for 2 hours and then drove across town to another hotel in an ice storm just to get away. Took a shower as soon as I arrived at new hotel! Will never, ever go back here. Worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great times...”
Reviews.Author: Maninthegreenshirt
Reviews.Content: My daughter is in the her first year at U Penn and I visited her this month from the UK for the first time. This hotel has a lot to recommend it. Great location near the art museum, great view from the room - see photo. The king bed was enormous and one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom was clean with a powerful shower. Ok the windows did need cleaning and the hotel carpets were a little on the dark side. The sports bar run by the friendly and entertaining Josh and Joanna was a wonderful place to wile away the evening watching basketball or listening to music. The reception staff were professional and responded well to smiles and a hello. The breakfast was fine and the staff here friendly too. And the parking is FREE. This hotel is just right for my purposes and I will stay there again when I visit my daughter next. You would not get this value for money in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but showing its age”
Reviews.Author: bauserdotcom
Reviews.Content: My job picked this hotel for me on a 2007 trip, but I liked it enough to use it again in 2008. As others have said, the facilities are definitely showing their age. (My coworker hated the place because it charged extra for a mini-refrigerator.) On the other hand, I found the staff to be friendly (especially in the restaurant), and the location is great for the price -- it's a five minute walk to the Philadelphia Museum of Art and Eastern State Penitentiary, and close to the highway. As someone who had to drive all over the city, I found it to be a good, centrally-located 'base of operations.' The place is usually half-empty during the week (so there's plenty of parking if you have local friends stopping by, like I did), but fills up on the weekends. A big warning for people who like to eat at their hotel, though: The hotel restaurant is only open for breakfast. The hotel bar is open later, but the food is greasy sports bar cuisine and they don't do room service. I ended up getting a lot of late dinners from the deli across the street. Overall, I think the location makes up the flaws of being an older hotel. I would be willing to stay there on my own money.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: rklebo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed and will continue to stay at this Best Western during my husband's treatment at Temple University Med Ctr and the staff has been nothing but great. While there isn't any time for site seeing there is need of pharmacys, Wal-mart & help with the Septa buses and we can always count on the helpful staff, from the housekeepers, front desk personnell, bartender and even a friendly cabbie who gave me great directions at the bar to the wal-mart! Wasn't looking for a super deluxe room, just comfortable and clean. Its in a safe location and close to many attractions. Once we are able to take a vacation, I know where we are going and staying!

Reviews.Title: “reasonable price and location”
Reviews.Author: akanuma
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from Japan, and arrived from airport by rent-a-car. To tell the truth, I felt uneasy before checking in, because I read these reviews on internet. My first impression of this hotel is, not so bad, it is quite reasonable, I have made a good choice. It is true that this hotel is not a brand new one. However, rooms are spacy, bus tub is big, internet is available in the room, food shop is just in few miniutes walk, we can get to the center of the city in ten minutes by bus, bus station is just in front of the hotel, and what I like it best is we can park the car for free. No hotels in the center of the city let us park a car for free. Staffs should not underestimate your hotel. I also hope you keep the price always the reasonable one.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: clyde21222
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice enough. Walkable to downtown if you are fit. Hitel needs remodleing. Staff were very nice and free parking is great perk that close to downtown. I paid $150 would have fealt better if Ihad paid $100

Reviews.Title: “rudest staff I have ever come across”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights this October. Main reason for choice was the location and car parking. Two of the staff - those working in the bar - called Josh and Joanne- were great, really friendly and helpful. As for the rest - what a surly, rude and unhelpful lot. One of the girls on the front desk was downright insolent and the two working on breakfast could not be bothered to do anything. I regularly recommend hotels to my friends from the UK who are travelling to the USA. Not this one!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewere else”
Reviews.Author: cabelas
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed it. Would not reccommend it to anyone. The halls are dark, carpet worn, bathroom dirty, window would not open, air was not working. And large dogs barking in the next room. Some guys were doing push up's in the hall and would not move so I could walk down the hall way. The frontdesk person was friendly when we checked in and the security guard was helpful. That is the only two good things I can say. For the food - eat somewere else.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: nonicki
Reviews.Content: You get exactly what you pay for! It's an average hotel for an average price. When we were there the pool was closed due to construction on the parking lot. Unfortunately this was the reason why we booked this hotel. It was very hard to find parking space, but the staff was very helpful. The first day we had problems with the toilet, but it was fixed within minutes after I made a call to the reception, absolutely great! The room we stayed in was OK, could have been cleaner. All in all it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Shut it down”
Reviews.Author: Chelseablue14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel simply because it had a car park and was reasonably close to the City Centre. It was a mistake. The Car Park is the only good thing about it. The corridors and public areas are dirty and tatty. Our room was only just livable in. The windows did not open or close properly. We certainly would not eat there. The staff were unhelpful. Our judgement is coloured by the fact that someone (a fellow guest! I think) entered our room (our fault) and stole a camera. At that stage the staff were concerned but could not do anything. I think the hotel should be pulled down. If you stay there you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience in Philly”
Reviews.Author: Shnitzel
Reviews.Content: Restaurant employees just ignored us when we came down for breakfast. No one greeted us when we entered restaurant and had to have person at front desk call for table help. Rooms and halls seemed to be below the quality I've seen from Best Western hotels.

Reviews.Title: “just came back from Philly. The hotel is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: louiseb_8
Reviews.Content: we had a poor experience staying at this hotel. We booked this hotel because it was close to the Zoo and had a pool. In calling to confirm our reservation the hotel clerk was rude. When we arrived at the hotel, we found out that the only pool was closed,due to renovations. This was never mentioned when booking, even though it was obvious the renovations were going to be lengthy as an entire section of the hotel was torn down.The hotel is very old.The bathtub had rusty stain around the drain and the drain wasn't draining.When booking out, the clerk on duty was quite rude again and with A LOT of attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Exactly Feeling our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gramercy97
Reviews.Content: I'm usually very tolerant with hotels. A budget traveler, I'm always prepared to be surprised. We stayed here over President's Day weekend and I was sorely lamenting the fact that the other Best Western in the city didn't have rooms available (I had stayed at that location exactly the year before and loved everything about it.) First off, if you are going to Philadelphia for the art museums, this hotel is close. If you are driving and need parking, this hotel is fine. Parking is free. However, if you want to tour the historical areas, I wouldn't recommend a stay here. We were under the impression that public transportation would be easily accessible. It's not. At least in this area, you have to wait on only one bus route that seemed to come infrequently throughout our entire stay. The hotel was not what we had envisioned. The building is dumpy and one part of the building looks abandoned, complete with ripped window shades. Not exactly inviting. Maybe they were remodeling that part? The area was not Center City, more like the fringes, and there is no nightlife (restaurants, stores, etc) to be found here. The hallways were dark and dingy and lights were out in some parts of corridors to our room. The heater blew hot air in one area and you had to blast it in order to somewhat heat up your room, which took a long time. Not good for a cold February stay! Overall, our experience was unpleasant. I was surprised that some sort of breakfast wasn't included considering the Best Western across town has it. Overall, we were surprised that this was a Best Western and would have been more resigned to our fate had it been an economy hotel. While the rooms are shabby, the room we stayed in was clean. That, I will give it.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad!”
Reviews.Author: BabeinWoods
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this hotel, I had nightmares. Literally. I feared it would be dirty and unsafe. I found the hotel to be clean, the staff to be pleasant and helpful, and the location to be great. It was safe and a bargin for the city. However, the decor could use updating, and the hotel was dark. Since we were out sightseeing all day, it was the perfect place to sleep and not much else. I wouldn't stay here if you wanted to spend a ton of time in your hotel room, but it's a fine clean, safe, central location for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great for exactly 1 day”
Reviews.Author: BedStuy14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was looking for a location close to the downtown area (Chestnut/Walnut/30th St, etc) without paying for the Sheraton or Loew's. The going rate was $165, I booked on Expedia for $145 (which is still the reg. price when you add local taxes, very clever, Expedia). Neither price is worth the simplicity and lack of fringes of this hotel, but maybe $165 doesn't go as far as it used to. The hotel was clean, the epitome of basic. The desk people were polite. Despite the warmth outside, the room held a chill, which its heating system did not cure. I let it run on 75 for hours while I was out and returned to a cold room. Since I was only there to rest my head and luggage, I opted not to complain, but it was inconvenient. The bed was comfortable w/the typically musty-looking comforter. The bathroom was average size, but the tub showed signs of wear (rusty brown stain around the drain). The dollar bill feeder on the 1st floor snack machine was broken. The blue paisley, fork-in-the-road design of the 2nd floor hallway looked like something out of The Shining as did the creaky, slow-moving elevator. There's one free computer for use in the lobby, so that was helpful. Avoid the hot continental breakfast. I got sick to my stomach before it was digested fully. The pastries and juice are fine, but the sausage and egg did not go over well. I was able to leave my luggage for later pick-up on check-out day and it was all returned to me intact. Overall, I would've been miserable spending an entire weekend here, but for one night, my inner cheapskate was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Maxxy0000
Reviews.Content: I was here at this Best Western this weekend. It continues to be one of my favorite hotels in Philadelphia. Clerks allowed me to check in early. Housekeeping was extremely prompt in putting new batteries in remote. Very quiet, nice location, not too far from airport, very nice taxi stand!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Disturbing”
Reviews.Author: BethCat
Reviews.Content: Maybe other people have had a better experience but I think this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was non-smoking but still smelled like smoke. When I pulled back the covers there was a hair on the sheets AND in the bathroom trash can there was a q-tip - even if it was a clean one, I wouldn't want to know! Gross and kind of sketchy - ESPECIALLY for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra money and stay some place else”
Reviews.Author: Rayne21787
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband got to the hotel and the woman who checked us in was very helpful. We walk up to our room along the way saying hello to the house keeping and they all just looked at us with this "snot" attitude. Okay, their just having a bad day we thought. We went to lunch at their Sports Bar and the waitress was very nice. Food had no complaints. I went to take a shower and notice that there was used soap still in the tub and a couple of the empty bottles of the shampoo. Thats when I started noticing everything else wrong with the room. Rooms were clearly not vacuumed and there was dubree and other peoples small belongings, such as a key and a lighter, hiding under the media center. The only thing the house keepers could of possibly done in our room was place fresh towells in the bathroom and make the bed. It was okay for the one night we were staying in Philidelphia. Any longer and we would have paid the extra money to stay at the Sheraton down the street. This hotel...NOT WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: Byblos2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected by a reservation group that handled our conference. It is a real dump. NO HEAT. We tried turning the heater on and it sounded as if the entire building was on the verge of collapse. When we called customer service we were told they were "working on it". It's going on 8:00 and we are still wearing layers of sweaters and scarves. The bathroom door was warped and would not close. You can see through the sheets. I was afraid to ride the elevator, as it looked like something out of a horror flick. The lock on the room doors are the size of lunch boxes. I've never seen anything like it. The staff were nice but turned rude when we asked if they would be able to fix the heat or if we could possibly receive a discount. This is the worst place that I have ever experienced. Save your money...it is a real dump and needs major renovations. One side of the hotel looks as if it is being bulldozed. The windows are knocked out and it looks vacant. I will leave a note for the manager, as this is unacceptable for $110 a night. I would have paid more just to be able to take my scarf off. The pictures on their website were probably taken 20+ years ago. Save yourself the agony.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: bodine1
Reviews.Content: I saw no real problem with this place, we had the money to stay at an expensive place, but why waste the money, we were only going to sleep and clean up there.The staff treated us very nice and the room was clean and the beds were comfortable,the sheets were very clean, the lights, tv, coffee maker, hair blower, etc all worked fine, sure it could use a refurbish, especially the outside and the halls, but the rooms where you stay are well kept. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to see.And the parking was free.We paid $129.00 used AARP card.We noticed no smells as others have said and our room was very clean.We had a good night there, will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Dump”
Reviews.Author: NJFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Two sentence summary - Definitely not a place to stay for a family vacation. At best, it would be adequate for a business traveler on a tight budget. There was a large convention in town the weekend we were travelling to Philly. Many of the nice hotels were fully booked, and the three nice hotels that had rooms available had rates starting at $280/night and up (usually the room rates are under $200/night in these hotels). We decided to stay at the BW for $147/night. BIG mistake. The baseboard heater in our room was on full blast all night, but the room was still cold, even though the temp. outside didn't go below 40 degrees. The baseboard heater is only about 3 feet wide - the room needed a wider baseboard heater. The towels were very thin, and when I asked for 2 extra bath towels and hand towels, no hand towels were available - they brought two bath towels and two washcloths instead - if they were smart, they would have brought 4 bath towels. The hallways are dimly lit. The place is clean, but in desperate need of being renovated. It sorely lacks a cheerful, inviting atmosphere. The breakfast was good. I had the cold buffet breakfast, and the rest of my family ordered off of the menu - decent service, reasonably priced for a hotel. Free breakfast is NOT included with the room. Thee parking is free, which is a big plus over the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, bad”
Reviews.Author: BoddingtonB
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst welcome to a hotel I've ever had, from hilariously rude woman on reception. They finally found our booking - under the wrong name, for the wrong night, and wrong number of rooms. Despite having been through it all twice with someone else on the phone earlier that morning, because "the system crashed". Hmm. The rooms themselves were pretty scruff and small. But, oh my God, the shower was amazing! The highlight of our stay. Oh, and I wouldn't take your family there by the way, because it's located a few blocks from the local jail, so we looked on in bemusement in the hotel bar as an impromptu "getting out" party was held for a guy who woke up behind bars that morning!

Reviews.Title: “Not Best, but Worst Western Center City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parismorning
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately there was nothing else in the city available under $400/nt for my dates. First impressions: the exterior is dismal and crumbling, and it only gets worse from there. The interior overwhelms you with the smells of mold and mildew, likely coming from the ancient faded carpet and walls. I spent three unfortunate nights here, and the moldy/mildewy atmosphere has left me with a bad case of bronchitis and laryngitis. The covers on the bed were so old and stained and disgusting, I held it with 2 fingers, and pulled it to the floor, forcing myself to sleep in a cold room without covers, lest I would catch something worse and more contagious than a cold. As for the location, it claims to be Center City, but it really on the fringe. There is no reasonably close public transit, so be prepared to take cabs everywhere. Conclusion: Everything is in disrepair and very rundown. It is time they just take a bulldozer to the place. I will never stay here again. It is not just aesthetic, but for health that I warn against the "Best" Western Center City Philadelphia.

Reviews.Title: “Condemned Building”
Reviews.Author: repulsedcustomer
Reviews.Content: The hotel exterior looked like a rundown housing complex ie blinds missing, buiding edges chip ,brownish dirty look. Window frames old and bent. Front desk help pleasant and honest. I asked if this was a historical site and the clerk responded no, just an old building. Getting right to the point. The fitness room carpet smelled of mold; the employee lounge looked like a drug infested gathering place. The elevators, hallways, and rooms, were deplorable and smelling horribly of mold and mildew. The room interior light was low wattage the thermostat was broken. The caulking around the tub was moldy; ceiling looked unstable with water stains. The size of the room reminded me of a dog house. Flees and all. I didn't want to remove my clothes and was afraid to pull back the sheets. Mind you, I only plan to stay for one night. In summation, no dollar amount could warrant my stay/family stay at such a hole. I ascertained all of this in five minutes and checked out! I would not recommend this to any human being concerned with habitable living conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep cheap, Eat well”
Reviews.Author: E-Jag
Reviews.Content: Forewarned was fore-prepared. Having read the reviews of this hotel we took a flier and were pleasantly surprised. We saved almost $100 over comparables available in the same general area and wound up with a clean, quite room with a comfortable bed and a pretty convenient launching point to visit Philadelphia. Parking was easy and free. The only services/amenities we used except for check-in/out was fixing a dying smoke detector which was accomplished 15 minutes after I reported it at 11:00 pm. Everyone was courteous. So we took the savings and had dinner on the Moshula (see review) which was wonderful and wound up with a really memorable experience to take home, something we would have been unlikely to get from spending $100 or so more for a hotel room elsewhere. Stay here and spend the difference on something that REALLY makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: sophielaura
Reviews.Content: OK - cut to the truth. Everything about this hotel stinks. We stayed here for 1 night on the way from Washington to Cape Cod. Dirty carpets in the lobby, rooms were OK ish. Glad it was for one night only. Plus side, we didn't come on holiday to stay in the room, so went out and got off for 8.30am next day. Rocky steps near by, other than that will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet Rooms, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: sandlcampbell
Reviews.Content: We were a little unsure about this hotel due to some of the negative reviews, but, were pleasantly surprised once we arrived. The hotel is old, but well maintained. It's very closed to many of the tourist attractions and museums (with in walking distance). The hotel's shower was less than desirable (hot and cold difficult to maintain). The room we had was a good size and offered good wireless Internet access for free. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars???”
Reviews.Author: Ogorek
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Hotel choice in our 10 days trip (New York, Washington, Philadelphia).The smell in hotel and rooms very bad. Itâ€™s not cheap for what you get. Why is rated 3 stars??? Worst and the last Best Western for us.

Reviews.Title: “5 years and no change”
Reviews.Author: stevestevesteve
Reviews.Content: Our team stays in this hotel every year for a bike race in june, this was my 5th year there. We have a few terms that have been coined from staying there, "the worst western" and "philly SARS" referring to the awful feeling we get in our throat after using the air conditioning there and sleeping for a week there. We often are sick the few days after we leave. this place is very dirty, old and shouldnt even a brand hotel. I would be willing to pay way more to stay elswhere, although the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Leaudemiel
Reviews.Content: It's not luxurious. But its cheap. Close to the museums. Nice about parking. Nice staff. BUT if smoke and dogs bother you, do not stay here. The rooms smell smokie (we opened the window and were fine) and there was an unhappy dog two doors down. All in all, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “a decent place”
Reviews.Author: oldfart75
Reviews.Content: great deal for the location. no frills, but overall comfortable and friendly with free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for budget minded”
Reviews.Author: coldcut
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any issues with my stay. If you like having gold star super luxury hotel experiences this one certainly is not for you. Our group stayed there because it is walking distance from the Eastern State Penn Museum. Location It's close to the prison museum, Philadelphia Museum, Rocky statue, and restored water works buildings. The Old City and shopping is on the east side of the city. If I go again I would take the transit to get there instead of driving. Driving can be a headache as in any major city. The Mutter museum is south and not too far to drive, perhaps 5 minutes. The view was very nice. There was a nice deli across the street to eat breakfast at. Food Breakfast is served near the lobby and it's definitely not worth it. It's $6 for continental breakfast, $11 for warm buffet. The food is not great for the price. Skip it for Dennys or the deli across the street on Spring Garden Road. There is also a sports bar in the Hotel that looked like a dark dive to me. Service The service was pretty good. The staff was never rude or ambivalent. They answered any questions we had with a smile. The kitchen staff was a bit surprised with the large number of people in our group. I don't think they expect to see a lot of people at breakfast. The Room Decent but older due to the age of the hotel. There is wireless high speed access to the internet (also not the Philly has city wide free wireless access). The internet speed was pretty good. TV was nice and even had free HBO. The bathroom as not the most high tech but got the job done. It felt more like a motel than a hotel. There were plenty of towels. Soap and Shampoo provided was nothing fancy. Other stuff There is an outdoor pool that I wasn't too keen on visiting. The elevators are really old and take a while to get moving. I thought they were freight elevators at first. Ice machines were on every floor. We were on the third floor and also had a pop machine (Pepsi, no Coke). Overall Our group paid about $90 per room. I think this is a good price considering it's a major metropolitan city with many rooms costing over $200 a night. If you want to see Philadelphia and your counting your pennies this could be the place for you as long as you understand the limitations. If you want luxury I would definitely stay in the old city near the waterfront and pay the extra for a more luxurious hotel. I was satisfied but might choose a hotel in the old city next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: holycow709
Reviews.Content: As others said in their reviews, this hotel is tired looking, but the location makes it worth it all. Its within walking distance to the Phil. Museum of Art, Rodin Museum, The Franklin Institue,etc. If you can live with the tired look, and just be happy with its location its worth it......if your the picky type...don't. Its also one of the few motels that has on site parking for free.

Reviews.Title: “crappy hotel but cheap”
Reviews.Author: cargio17
Reviews.Content: we live in the city and had to stay here when our house wasn't habitable. it is a stale hotel - more like a motel. probably the shabbiest in center city - but its near everything and cheap. so if you want to save $$ - book here and just sleep - dont plan to hang out. also - rumors have it that it will be turned to condos soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just What I needed”
Reviews.Author: BrwnSunTan
Reviews.Content: stayed at this property in Feb. while attending a conference in Philadelphia. I was a little leary after reading some comments on TRIP ADVISOR but needless to say, YOU CANT BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU HEAR OR READ. I was a single female traveling alone from Tempe AZ and I felt quite safe. The front desk staff were attentive, the rooms were newly renovated and the FREE HSIA was much appreciated. No, it's not the Marriott, Hilton or Lowes but it is exactly what you look for in a Best Western. They B&W Sports Bar was a delight to watch the Super Bowl, apparently this is a "neighborhood favorite spot". It was really close to the Philadlephia Museum of Art. I could walk there The food was fun and I just had to comment to the "nay sayers", everything aint for everybody- but this was exactly "Just what I needed for my visit to Philadlephia...and I will be back! Koodles BW, you will always be my first choice!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Center City Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 501 North 22nd Street, Philadelphia, PA 19130
